item.title: Flattr - From the makers of the Pirate Bay
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
The one huge issue I’d foresee with this is moderating posts; specifically, there is a heavy risk of the wrong person being paid for someone. For instance, OriginalCreator77 puts up his own video on a personal website, and offers a Flattr link. Since his site is pretty obscure, no one notices it. Then, RePoster666 downloads the video and puts it on YouTube, then submits the link to Flattr. Since it’s YouTube, and the second guy came up with a more catchy submission title, everyone clicks his link. He makes $17 while the original guy gets nothing.

Unless they can come up with an infallible method of preventing that scenario, I’m not sure if I could support it.

item.dc:creator: Bolteh
item.description:
That’s a black man’s voice behind that video… I knew it, TPB was/is run by black people!

NIG*** STOLE MAH SOFTWARE!

Anyway, I like the concept, though I’m not sure whether it’ll be successful/used that often. A lot of people still have the mindset that there’s no money to be given when there’s a chance to get it for free. I don’t think a lot of people will send micropayments to a blogger because he writes a funny text on a daily basis. Or to someone like me, that updates his portfolio every now and then.
